intro: Allosorus durus, commonly known as the desert lily, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features a rosette of thick, fleshy, gray-green leaves that store water, aiding in its survival in dry environments. The plant produces a tall, slender stem that bears showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. Its reproductive system relies on insect pollination, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Allosorus durus is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and minimal rainfall, making it a resilient species in its habitat.
